item.description:
Tom Daley’s poetry has been published or is forthcoming in Denver Quarterly, Massachusetts Review, Fence, Harvard Review, In Posse Review, Barrow Street, conte, Poetry Ireland Review, Rhino, and Diagram, and has been anthologized in Hacks: The Grub Street Anthology; Poets for Haiti; and Unlocking the Poem.

Elizabeth Quinlan is the author of Promise Supermarket (Ibbetson Street Press), a book of memoir poems: the first of a three part series. This Roslindale resident is also a visual artist specializing in the Book and the Fabric Arts. She is a graduate of the Boston Museum of Fine Arts School, and U. Mass. Boston where she received an Honor in Creative Writing/Poetry. Elizabeth is working on a collection of poems based on the life and times of Maud Cuney-Hare, the eminent scholar of African American Music as well as the Diaspora.

Emcee and Roslindale resident Peter Bates has published in the St. John's Prep Concordia, The Bates College Student, the Boston Globe, the Boston Phoenix, Bostonia, the Boston Business Journal, Radical America, Lynx Eye, Aspect, Laughing Bear, Gray Wolf, Jump Cut, the Potomac Review, Stony Hills, among others.

An open mic will follow these readers.  Please arrive promptly for seven if you wish to participate.
item.name: Rozzie Reads Poetry: Three Featured Poets and Open Mike
